experiences.title: STEM Education Intern - Near Space Education
experiences.description: Creating, developing, and teaching STEM curricula to Junior and Senior High school students for space camps. I researched and learned CAD, 3D printing, soldering, Micro:Bit Microcontrollers, basic electronics, and more with the goal to be able to teach students these valuable STEM skills. I helped launch several high altitude weather balloons to test hardware. Worked on editing/creating social media content for the camps, as well as the creation of fundraising webpages and a reconfiguration of the local network.

experiences.title: Student Cybersecurity Intern - Center for Technology Services
experiences.description: Working with the Gordon College Center for Technology Services' (CTS) Network Systems Group (NSG). Developing and maintaining cybersecurity applications and scripting.

experiences.title: ASC Peer Subject Tutor - Computer Science Lab
experiences.description: Working with Gordon's Academic Success Center (ASC) to host a bi-weekly computer science help session to offer assistance to first and second year students with their computer science coursework and projects.

experiences.title: President - Computer Science Club
experiences.description: Volunteer position, involving planning, organizing, and handling communication for events for the computer science club. As the president, I led a small, dedicated team of students to run fun and educational extra-curricular events for computer science students and peers.

experiences.title: Head Dispatcher - Gordon Police
experiences.description:
In addition to my responsibilities as a dispatcher and senior dispatcher, I stepped into the student manager role: overseeing scheduling, shift coverage, interviews, hiring decisions, training, organization, staff communications, and meetings for a team of a dozen student dispatchers.  

As part of my job, I developed a new workflow for scheduling. Since my team consisted entirely of student workers, the work schedule had to accommodate classes and other jobs. I implemented a system using Google Forms and Calendar to allow dispatchers to enter their availability and shift preferences using a google form, which would auto-populate a Google Sheet. I then wrote a JavaScript program, using Google's Apps Script software, to take the spreadsheet data and convert it to calendar events, so I could easily visualize the shift preferences of my staff. This was a vast improvement over the previous workflow, which was simply based on email responses and manually populating a spreadsheet from those responses, which was far more error-prone and time-consuming.

experiences.title: WordWeather
experiences.description:
A web development project for CPS 353 Internet Programming.
    I worked with a student designer from ART 358 Web Design to create a design for a web-app that displays the current weather and a bible verse related to the current conditions.  I then implemented the design using SvelteKit, performing user studies, and adjusting the design as needed to create the final product.

experiences.title: Access Control Assistant - Center for Technology Services
experiences.description: Worked with several software systems to set up ID cards for students and faculty, effectively manage access on campus, and deal with customer requests and issues.

experiences.title: Summer Practicum Programmer - Computer Science Department
experiences.description: Worked with a team of student developers and professors programming features on a real application with real users. Gained experience applying agile methodologies, and updated a significant amount of the existing CSS styling to add appearance settings features to the app.

experiences.title: TA - CPS 122 Object Oriented Programming
experiences.description: Working with the CS department, offered weekly help sessions for students taking Object Oriented Programming. I helped students learn the concepts of object oriented programming in Java by assisting them with their projects and homework.

experiences.title: Peer Tutor - CPS 121 Introduction to Programming
experiences.description: Working with the academic support office as a peer tutor, running help and review sessions for the students taking Introduction to Programming. I helped students understand the basic concepts of program structure, logic, and Python programming for their homework and projects.

experiences.title: Senior Dispatcher - Gordon Police
experiences.description: In addition to my dispatch responsibilities, began assisting with training of new dispatchers, and data entry of paper logs and citations.

experiences.title: TA - CPS 121 Introduction to Programming
experiences.description: Assisted students through help in lab sessions and by running review and project help sessions outside of class. Helped students in Introduction to Programming learn basic programming concepts such as program structure, logic, and Python programming.

experiences.title: Dispatcher - Gordon Police
experiences.description: Answering service and emergency phone calls, communicating on the radio, assisting customers with requests and complaints, and handling emergency response.

other.title: CSS 3D Sphere
other.description: Play with and customize the sphere used in the website intro animation!

other.title: FireSim
other.description: A forest fire simulation, using grid based rules (similar to cellular automata) to generate interesting, endless forest fire animations

other.title: CSS Artwork
other.description:
Using CSS to draw shapes and create artwork.
    Plus some tests with animations using clip paths, and mapping animations to the scroll position using pure CSS, based by work by Kevin Powell on Youtube

other.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
other.description:
A project for CPS 353 Internet Programming.

  A simple HTML, CSS, JS webapp for playing Tic-Tac-Toe.  It even has a simple computer player (which is pretty easy to beat).  This was one of the first projects for the webdev class, and served as an introductory exercise.
